vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
συνέδρ-ιον, τό,
council, σ. κατασκευάζειν, συνάγειν, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; meeting, μεταπεμφθέντων εἰς κοινὸν σ. τῶν.. δεκανῶν [Refs 2nd c.BC+]; of a council of war, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; of the Areopagus, [Refs 4th c.BC+] together with the Areopagus, [Refs]; of a board of trade, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; of the Roman [Refs 2nd c.BC+]; the Jewish Sanhedrin, [NT+4th c.AD+]; τὸ σεμνότατον σ. τῆς γερουσίας, at Thasos, [Refs]; τὸ χωρίον ἐν ᾧ σ. ἦν αὐτῷ τῶν πολιτῶν [Refs 2nd c.AD+]; frequently of a congress of Allies or Confederates, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἁμῶν (i.e. τῶν Ἀμφικτιόνων) [Refs 3rd c.BC+]; τὸ Ἑλληνικὸν σ. [Refs 1st c.AD+]
__2 place of meeting, council-chamber, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἐν σ. in court, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
Sanhedrin; (local) council
primarily a sitting together, assembly, etc., in NT the Sanhedrin, the supreme council of the Jewish nation, Mt. 5:22; 26:59; metonymy the Sanhedrin, as including the members and place of meeting, Lk. 22:66; Acts 4:15; generically a judicial council, tribunal, Mt. 10:17; Mk. 13:9
vocabInfos._es_Definition: el sanedrín (consejo supremo judío para asunto religiosos y civiles) ; pl. tribunales judíos de cada localidad (MAT.10:17; MAR.13:9)
